summary: This document is a chain of email correspondence from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, primarily between an Assistant U.S. Attorney and an administrative contact, requesting and approving travel for the team investigating the Epstein case (United States v. Epstein, 2018R01618). The emails detail multiple planned trips to Los Angeles and West Palm Beach in 2019 for victim interviews and meetings.

connections.description: Both are part of the same investigation team from the Southern District of New York working on the Epstein case, coordinating travel for interviews.

events.title: Planned Interview in Los Angeles
events.description: The investigation team plans to travel to Los Angeles to conduct an interview related to the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Planned Interview in West Palm Beach
events.description: The investigation team plans to travel to West Palm Beach to conduct an interview related to the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Planned Victim Interview in Los Angeles
events.description: The investigation team plans to travel to Los Angeles for a victim interview related to the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Planned Meetings/Interviews in West Palm Beach
events.description: The investigation team plans to travel to West Palm Beach for approximately three days for meetings and interviews with victims.

events.title: Travel Request for West Palm Beach Meetings
events.description: Travel is requested for approximately three days for meetings and interviews in West Palm Beach for the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Initial Travel Request for Florida Meetings
events.description: Travel is requested for two days of meetings and interviews in West Palm Beach and/or Fort Lauderdale for the Epstein investigation.

locations: Southern District of New York, 1 St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
Doubletree, 1707 Fourth Street, Santa Monica, CA
keyFacts: The document references the ongoing federal investigation 'United States v. Epstein, 2018R01618', described as 'an investigation relating to enticement of minors for sexual activity'.
The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York was actively conducting victim interviews in Los Angeles and West Palm Beach throughout 2019 as part of the Epstein investigation.
Multiple travel requests in 2019 indicate a sustained investigative effort involving a team (including S and M) traveling to interview victims.
The email chain shows a pattern of travel for the investigation team, often requesting hotel conference rooms for conducting interviews.
The correspondence demonstrates the administrative and approval process within the U.S. Attorney's Office for investigative travel related to the Epstein case.
